results.title: Hearts and Minds
results.brief_description: Many times during his presidency, Lyndon B. Johnson said that ultimate victory in the Vietnam War depended upon the U.S. military winning the “hearts and minds” of the Vietnamese people. Filmmaker Peter Davis uses Johnson’s phrase in an ironic context in this anti-war documentary.

constellations_other.name: Dial M for Media
constellations_other.description: Explores the nature of media use in high-profile cases as well as the ability of media to sway public minds.

results.description: Many times during his presidency, Lyndon B. Johnson said that ultimate victory in the Vietnam War depended upon the U.S. military winning the “hearts and minds” of the Vietnamese people. Filmmaker Peter Davis uses Johnson’s phrase in an ironic context in this anti-war documentary, filmed and released while the Vietnam War was still under way, juxtaposing interviews with military figures like U.S. Army Chief of Staff William C. Westmoreland with shocking scenes of violence and brutality.
description_for_label: Many times during his presidency, Lyndon B. Johnson said that ultimate victory in the Vietnam War depended upon the U.S. military winning the “hearts and minds” of the Vietnamese people. Filmmaker Peter Davis uses Johnson’s phrase in an ironic context in this anti-war documentary, filmed and released while the Vietnam War was still under way, juxtaposing interviews with military figures like U.S. Army Chief of Staff William C. Westmoreland with shocking scenes of violence and brutality.

results.title: Heartbreak High
results.brief_description: Heartbreak High is a popular Australian TV series that dealt with the students at a tough high school in a multi-racial area of Sydney, and proved to be a more gritty and fast-paced show than many of its contemporaries.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

results.description: Heartbreak High is a popular Australian television series that ran for five years from 1994 to 1999. The series dealt with the students of Hartley High, a tough high school in a multi-racial area of Sydney, and proved to be a more gritty and fast-paced show than many of its contemporaries. It was a spin-off of the 1993 Australian feature film The Heartbreak Kid which had featured Alex Dimitriades and Claudia Karvan. However, in later seasons the show shifted emphasis away from the school setting and the Poulos Family to the students’ homes and hangout - the Shark Pool.
description_for_label: Heartbreak High is a popular Australian television series that ran for five years from 1994 to 1999. The series dealt with the students of Hartley High, a tough high school in a multi-racial area of Sydney, and proved to be a more gritty and fast-paced show than many of its contemporaries. It was a spin-off of the 1993 Australian feature film The Heartbreak Kid which had featured Alex Dimitriades and Claudia Karvan. However, in later seasons the show shifted emphasis away from the school setting and the Poulos Family to the students’ homes and hangout - the Shark Pool.

results.title: Hawke
results.creator_credit: The Film Company, Jeanie Cameron, Carrie Kennedy, Richard Keddie, Ben Morieson, Emma Freeman and Glen Dolman
results.brief_description: The story of Bob Hawke - Australia’s most loved Prime Minister as he faces his greatest challenge: a battle within his own party. As he fights for his life, we discover his incredible transformation from a hard-drinking womanising trade union leader into a visionary world leader. For a man who once sacrificed his family to his job, he must now rely solely on his friendships and allegiances to defeat his challenger and remain in power.
results.creator_credit_for_label: The Film Company, Jeanie Cameron, Carrie Kennedy, Richard Keddie, Ben Morieson, Emma Freeman and Glen Dolman

results.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2004
results.brief_description: Harry, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts for another magic-filled year. Harry comes face to face with danger yet again, this time in the form of escaped convict, Sirius Black—and turns to sympathetic Professor Lupin for help.
results.title_for_label: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2004
results.description: Harry, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts for another magic-filled year. Harry comes face to face with danger yet again, this time in the form of escaped convict, Sirius Black—and turns to sympathetic Professor Lupin for help.

results.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2011
results.brief_description: Harry, Ron and Hermione continue their quest to vanquish the evil Voldemort once and for all. Just as things begin to look hopeless for the young wizards, Harry discovers a trio of magical objects that endow him with powers to rival Voldemort’s formidable skills.
results.title_for_label: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2011
results.description: Harry, Ron and Hermione continue their quest to vanquish the evil Voldemort once and for all. Just as things begin to look hopeless for the young wizards, Harry discovers a trio of magical objects that endow him with powers to rival Voldemort’s formidable skills.

results.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2010
results.brief_description: Harry, Ron and Hermione walk away from their last year at Hogwarts to find and destroy the remaining Horcruxes, putting an end to Voldemort’s bid for immortality. But with Voldemort’s Death Eaters on the loose, the world is more dangerous than ever.

constellations_other.name: Reflecting duality and revealing new realities
constellations_other.description: The Toupie Fantoche relies on four prismatic mirrors to reflect changes in animation states.

constellations_other.name: Shadowplay and spookiness
constellations_other.description: Silhouettes and shadows scare up some of the most sinister creatures in cinema and videogames.

results.title_for_label: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2010

results.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
results.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
results.brief_description: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

results.title_for_label: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
results.headline_credit_for_label: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002

results.title: Hardcore Henry
results.headline_credit: Russia and United States of America, 2015
results.brief_description: Henry, a newly resurrected cyborg, must save his wife/creator from the clutches of a psychotic tyrant with telekinetic powers, AKAN, along with his army of mercenaries. Filmed like a first-person-shooter videogame, Hardcore Henry definitely lives up to its name.

constellations_other.name: Capturing first-person POV
constellations_other.description: A comparison of how videogames and feature films have used first person POV shots and sequences and how (for the latter) camera technology has impacted on this.

results.description: Henry, a newly resurrected cyborg who must save his wife/creator from the clutches of a psychotic tyrant with telekinetic powers, AKAN, and his army of mercenaries. Fighting alongside Henry is Jimmy, who is Henry’s only hope to make it through the day. Hardcore takes place over the course of one day, in Moscow, Russia.
description_for_label: Henry, a newly resurrected cyborg who must save his wife/creator from the clutches of a psychotic tyrant with telekinetic powers, AKAN, and his army of mercenaries. Fighting alongside Henry is Jimmy, who is Henry’s only hope to make it through the day. Hardcore takes place over the course of one day, in Moscow, Russia.

results.title: Hard to Handle: Bob Dylan in Concert
results.creator_credit: HBO, Wolfboy Productions and Gillian Armstrong
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1986
results.brief_description: In this concert filmed at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in 1986, Dylan is accompanied by Tom Petty and the band The Heartbreakers, as well as a very fine selection of new compositions in a concert film shot by Gillian Armstrong.

constellations_other.name: Brilliant careers (Gillian Armstrong)
constellations_other.description: Gillian Armstrong's feature film debut not only helped launch her own acclaimed career, but those of the actors as well.

results.title_for_label: Hard to Handle: Bob Dylan in Concert
results.description: Admired as one of the best lyricists of pop rock, Bob Dylan has his name recorded in music history. During his four decades career, he has been through many facets: from acoustic to electric guitar; from politicized to religious lyrics; from minimalist to very highly sophisticated arrangements. And his characteristic voice, for some, hoarse and full of style, for others a little out of tune, still influences many musicians. In this presentation filmed at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in Australia over February 24-25 1986, Dylan is accompanied by Tom Petty and the band The Heartbreakers, as well as a very fine selection of new compositions. To close the spectacle, Bob Dylan and Tom Petty perform a vocal duet in “Knockin’ on heaven’s door”, one of the most famous songs of this compositor.
description_for_label: Admired as one of the best lyricists of pop rock, Bob Dylan has his name recorded in music history. During his four decades career, he has been through many facets: from acoustic to electric guitar; from politicized to religious lyrics; from minimalist to very highly sophisticated arrangements. In this presentation filmed at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in Australia over February 24-25 1986, Dylan is accompanied by Tom Petty and the band The Heartbreakers, as well as a very fine selection of new compositions. To close the spectacle, Bob Dylan and Tom Petty perform a vocal duet in “Knockin’ on heaven’s door”, one of the most famous songs of this compositor.

results.title: Happy Feet
results.creator_credit: Kennedy Miller Productions, Animal Logic and George Miller
results.brief_description: Into the world of the Emperor Penguins, who find their soul mates through song, a penguin is born who cannot sing. But he can tap dance something fierce!

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Kennedy Miller Productions, Animal Logic and George Miller
results.description:
You would’ve thought that the mind that brought cinemas the Mad Max series would also gift audiences with a feet-tapping, family-friendly blockbuster like Happy Feet. Trading the desert wasteland for frigid Antarctica, George Miller’s animated 2006 hit follows a young penguin on a quest to find acceptance. For emperor penguins, attracting a mate is a matter of the heart – or the “heartsong” – but for Mumble (Elijah Wood), who can’t sing, only dance, this proves an issue. Ostracised and ridiculed by the other penguins, Mumble finds a family with the Amigos, who love the young penguin’s dance moves. A story about accepting ourselves and overcoming life’s obstacles, Happy Feet also has a positive environmental message and was the fourth non-Disney or Pixar film to win the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature.

Aside from Miller, who directed, produced and co-wrote the film, Happy Feet has another Australian connection (besides an all-star Aussie cast) with its visual effects done by acclaimed Sydney-based animation studio Animal Logic – their first in a long string of hits that includes The Lego Movie.
description_for_label:

Trading the desert wasteland for frigid Antarctica, George Miller’s animated 2006 hit follows a young penguin on a quest to find acceptance. For emperor penguins, attracting a mate is a matter of the heart – or the “heartsong” – but for Mumble (Elijah Wood), who can’t sing, only dance, this proves an issue. Ostracised and ridiculed by the other penguins, Mumble finds a family with the Amigos, who love the young penguin’s dance moves. A story about accepting ourselves and overcoming life’s obstacles, Happy Feet also has a positive environmental message and was the fourth non-Disney or Pixar film to win the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature.
